meanings.def: pleased because you have achieved something or because something that you wanted to happen has happened
examples: a satisfied customer
a satisfied smile
satisfied with somebody/something She's never satisfied with what she's got.
The Olympic athlete was satisfied with her performance.
They were not satisfied with the outcome of the talks.
a happy marriage/​memory/​childhood
I said I’d go, just to keep him happy.
She’s never satisfied with what she’s got.
a satisfied smile
I’m perfectly content just to lie in the sun.
a contented baby
a long contented sigh
three blissful weeks away
Sarah watched, a satisfied expression on her face.
He declared himself satisfied with the results.
Her parents seemed satisfied enough with her progress.
I felt well satisfied with my day's work.
She seemed satisfied with the arrangements.

meanings.def: believing or accepting that something is true
examples: satisfied (that)… I'm satisfied that they are telling the truth.
Police were satisfied that the death was accidental.
I am quite satisfied he will return to France.
satisfied with something She seemed satisfied with my explanation.
The police are not satisfied with the answers they have received.
We are still not entirely satisfied with the explanation offered.
satisfied of something (formal) You need to be satisfied of all the facts.
